decks.notes: This deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures with disruptive abilities to slow down the opponent's game plan. By using hatebears like Anointed Peacekeeper, Archon of Emeria, Chancellor of the Annex, and Seasoned Dungeoneer, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while applying pressure with efficient creatures. Additionally, the deck includes cards like Chalice of the Void, Trinisphere, and March of Otherworldly Light to further disrupt the opponent's plays and gain an advantage. The mana base is optimized with fast mana sources like Chrome Mox and mana acceleration from cards like Ancient Tomb and Sol Ring.

The deck focuses on an aggressive playstyle, utilizing powerful spells and fast mana acceleration to disrupt opponent's strategies and push for a quick victory. By combining card draw, counter spells, and efficient removal options, along with powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler, the deck aims to maintain control of the game while applying pressure on the opponent. The inclusion of versatile cards like Hullbreacher and Snapcaster Mage allows for flexibility in adapting to different situations, while the mana base supports a consistent and efficient mana curve for casting spells.

This deck aims to generate a large amount of mana through fast mana sources and artifacts to enable casting powerful spells like Paradoxical Outcome for card advantage and combo potential. The deck also includes disruption in the form of counterspells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce, as well as removal like Swords to Plowshares. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion allows for recursion of key cards from the graveyard, adding resilience to the combo strategy. Overall, this deck focuses on fast, explosive plays and efficient use of resources to win the game quickly.

The deck relies on utilizing powerful mana accelerants and card draw spells to quickly assemble the Underworld Breach combo. Lurrus of the Dream-Den serves as a companion to provide additional value and recursion. The goal is to generate infinite storm count by casting and recasting spells from the graveyard using Underworld Breach, enabling a lethal Brain Freeze or Auriok Salvagers loop to deck the opponent. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Force of Will to protect the combo and stay ahead of opponents.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively use Bazaar of Baghdad and various discard outlets to quickly and efficiently fill the graveyard with creatures like Blazing Rootwalla, Hollow One, and Vengevine. By utilizing cards like Force of Will and Force of Negation to protect key pieces, along with disruptive spells like Mindbreak Trap, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creature threats and tempo plays. Additionally, cards like Noxious Revival and Serum Powder help with consistency and graveyard manipulation to ensure a fast and explosive game plan.

The main focus of this deck is to generate a large amount of mana using cards like Mishra's Workshop, Grim Monolith, and Coveted Jewel, while also utilizing powerful artifacts such as Paradoxical Outcome and Phyrexian Metamorph to achieve a game-winning combo. The deck also includes key cards like Tinker, Time Vault, and Time Walk to further enhance its combo potential. Additionally, cards like Force of Will and Trinisphere provide disruption and protection. Overall, the deck aims to create a powerful and fast-paced combo strategy to overwhelm and defeat the opponent.

This deck focuses on using fast mana accelerants like the Moxen and Mana Crypt to power out powerful artifacts quickly. The deck's goal is to assemble a combo using Time Vault and one of the multiple ways to untap it like Manifold Key or Karn, the Great Creator's -2 ability. It also utilizes cards like The One Ring and Nettlecyst to pump up its creatures and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive threats. The deck aims to be fast and disruptive, putting pressure on the opponent while also controlling the board with cards like Strip Mine and Lodestone Golem.
